meta_description.title: Joust Definition & Meaning - Merriam-Webster
meta_description.text: The meaning of joust is to fight on horseback as a knight or man-at-arms. How to use joust in a sentence.

meta_description.text: Joust is an action game developed by Williams Electronics and released in arcades in 1982. meta_description.title: Jousting - Wikipedia
meta_description.text: Jousting is a martial game or hastilude between two horseriders wielding lances with blunted tips, often as part of a tournament. meta_description.title: joust | medieval sport | Britannica
meta_description.text: joust, western European mock battle between two horsemen charging each other with levelled lances, each attempting to unhorse the other.Related Topics: Middle Ages tournament tiltingMajor Events: Migration periodKey People: Arthur M. Sackler

meta_description.title: Play classic Joust Arcade Game Online - Nintendo, Atari and ...
meta_description.text: Game History: Joust is an arcade game developed by Williams Electronics and released in 1982. It is a platform game that features two-dimensional (2D) graphics.

meta_description.title: joust - Dictionary Definition : Vocabulary.com
meta_description.text: To joust is to fight against someone, usually using lances, on horseback. Such a contest is called a joust. knowledge_panel.description: jousting is a martial game or hastilude between two horseriders wielding lances with blunted tips, often as part of a tournament. wikipedia

def_list.definition: (of a medieval knight) engage in a sports contest in which two opponents on horseback fight with lances.
def_list.example: "to joust, a man must have an opponent to ride against"

dictionary.type: verb: joust; 3rd person present: jousts; past tense: jousted; past participle: jousted; gerund or present participle: jousting

def_list.definition: a medieval sports contest in which two opponents on horseback fought with lances.
def_list.example: "the king and the young knights at court passed their time in jousts, tournaments, and the chase"
